H0.text: Prokaryotic cells are cells without a nucleus.

H1.text: Monocyte cells are cells without a nucleus.

H2.text: Heterogeneous cells are cells without a nucleus.

H3.text: Crustal cells are cells without a nucleus.

A4.text: The distinction is that eukaryotic cells have a 'true' nucleus containing their DNA, whereas prokaryotic cells do not have a nucleus.

A5.text: Prokaryotes evolved before eukaryotes, and lack nuclei, mitochondria, and most of the other distinct organelles that characterize the eukaryotic cell.
